snp4.9:1.1: On seeing Craving, Passion and Lust,
snp4.9:1.2: Even then there was no sexual desire.
snp4.9:1.3: What of this faeces and urine-filled thing?
snp4.9:1.4: I would not even touch it with my foot!”
snp4.9:2.1: “If you do not want such a jewel—
snp4.9:2.2: A woman sought-after by many kings—
snp4.9:3.1: “It does not occur to me ‘I proclaim this’—
snp4.9:3.3: Something taken up having judged between ideas.
snp4.9:3.4: Maintaining perspective amidst views, not taking up,
snp4.9:3.5: I saw, and recognised, internal peace.”
snp4.9:4.3: Sage, you speak of ‘not taking them up’—
snp4.9:4.4: Then what does it mean, ‘internal peace’?
snp4.9:4.5: How is it described by the wise?”
snp4.9:5.1: “Purity is not told by view or knowledge
snp4.9:5.3: Or in terms of learning, or virtue-observance,
snp4.9:5.4: Yet not without view, learning, knowledge,
snp4.9:5.5: Nor again without virtue and observances.
snp4.9:5.6: Without taking up in letting these go,
snp4.9:5.7: One who is calmed without support would not hope for any state of being.”
snp4.9:6.1: “If purity is not told by view or knowledge
snp4.9:6.3: Or in terms of learning, or virtue-observance
snp4.9:6.4: Yet still not without learning, knowledge, view
snp4.9:6.5: Nor again without virtue and observances,
snp4.9:6.6: Then I think it all of a muddle, such teaching:
snp4.9:6.7: Some refer to purity through view.”
snp4.9:7.3: You have fallen into confusion within what you already assumed.
snp4.9:7.4: You did not glimpse the faintest notion of this,
snp4.9:7.5: And so you take it as all of a muddle.
snp4.9:8.1: One thinking in terms of equal, or better,
snp4.9:8.2: Or worse, might argue on such grounds.
snp4.9:8.3: But when one is unshaken in these three ways,
snp4.9:8.4: For him there is no ‘equal or better’.
snp4.9:9.1: Why should a brahman assert ‘This is True!’?
snp4.9:9.2: Who should he refute, saying ‘This is False!’?
snp4.9:9.4: In whose argument should he participate?
snp4.9:10.1: The household forsaken, a homeless wanderer,
snp4.9:10.2: In the village the sage does not forge intimacies.
snp4.9:10.3: Empty of sense desires, without insistence,
snp4.9:10.4: He would not quarrel with anyone.
snp4.9:11.1: Living apart from all that is worldly,
snp4.9:11.2: Without taking it up, the Great would speak.
snp4.9:11.3: Just as the spiked lotus, water-born,
snp4.9:11.4: In the mud and in water remains unsoiled,
snp4.9:11.5: So the sage, affirming peace, free of greed,
snp4.9:11.6: Remains unsoiled amidst sense pleasures and the world.
snp4.9:12.1: The master of wisdom neither by thought nor by view
snp4.9:12.2: Can be measured—he is not determined by that.
snp4.9:12.3: Not led by what is done or what is learned,
snp4.9:12.4: He is not brought to land in any domain.
snp4.9:13.1: One dispassionate towards perceptions has no ties;
snp4.9:13.2: One freed through understanding has no confusion.
snp4.9:13.3: But those who have taken up perceptions and views,
snp4.9:13.4: Colliding, they go round the world.”
